title: Okami 2 announced by PlatinumGames and Ikumi Nakamura… maybe? We’re not sure
text:
Okami – is a sequel really happening?

Hideki Kamiya may finally be getting his chance to make a sequel to Capcom classic Okami, unless he’s making a particularly cruel joke.

If you take the video below at face value then PlatinumGames co-founder and Okami director Hideki Kamiya has just confirmed that he’s working on a sequel.

Except, no other announcement has been made and Kamiya is infamous for joking around and trolling his fans on Twitter.

The video was tweeted by Ikumi Nakamura, who stole the show at Bethesda’s E3 event this year but recently left The Evil Within developer Tango GameWorks for parts unknown.

Okami is going to be back! We want to make Okami sequel and fans are looking forward to it too. You guys want to see Kamiya’s Okami again, right, everyone? I want to work on it too! 大神をまた作りたい私たちです。🙏😊@CapcomUSA_ @OKAMI_CAP pic.twitter.com/bLwuGnTew1 — Ikumi Nakamura (@nakamura193) October 18, 2019

Nakamura was at TangoGameWorks for nine years but previous to that she worked at Platinum as a concept designer on Bayonetta and before that worked on… Okami.

That still doesn’t help us work out whether this is a gag or not, although Kamiya has been talking about making a sequel to the game for years.

In fact, he hinted at exactly that to us a few years back at E3, although obviously nothing ever came of it – as far as we know.

Kamiya (and presumably Nakamura) has lots of friends at Capcom though and it just so happens that today we ran a story about Capcom talking about reviving dormant franchises.

Okami was never a major hit, despite multiple remasters, and there was already a sequel on DS – that had nothing to do with the original team – but as one of the best Zelda-seque action adventures ever made we’d love to see it get a proper follow-up, and it’s obvious Kamiya would too.
